alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 11:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Carbon and southwestern Albany Counties through 1215 AM MDT... At 1128 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Skyline to near Illinois Creek Campground. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... French Creek Campground around 1140 PM MDT. Miller Lake Campground and Evans Creek Campground around 1145 PM MDT. Bobbie Thompson Campground around 1155 PM MDT. Lake Owen, Lake Owen Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir and Rob Roy Campground around 1200 AM MDT. Sugar Loaf Campground around 1205 AM MDT. Albany, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Brooklyn Lake and Nash Fork Campground around 1210 AM MDT. Centennial, Libby Creek Campground and North Fork Campground around 1215 AM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
